note: The FBI takes reported crime data and adjusts it for gaps and underreporting to provide consistent long-term estimates over time. That means it may be different to reported crime figures.
title: Estimated violent crime rate in the United States
subtitle: Estimated [violent crime](#dod:violent-crime) rate per 100,000 people. Violent crime includes four offenses: murder and nonnegligent manslaughter, rape, [robbery](#dod:robbery), and [aggravated assault](#dod:aggravated-assault).
